title: SS.PT.462
prompt:
Economies can be categorized into four different types: traditional, market, command, and mixed. Economic decisions are made by different parts of society in different types of economies. Economic decisions can be made by the people of a society, by governments, or by businesses and consumers.

Match each statement with the correct economy from the dropdown menu.

The central government plans to produce 2.5 million cars next year.
![dropdown:Drop_Down_3196_264]
The men of an African tribe move their herd of cattle to a better grazing area.
![dropdown:Drop_Down_3196_265]
Consumers in a country are free to choose from limitless goods and services.
![dropdown:Drop_Down_3196_266]
The central government decides to lower taxes on all cars imported into a country.
![dropdown:Drop_Down_3196_267]
feedback: Governments direct how much to produce in command economies. Traditional economies are made up of “traditional” economic activity, like herding cattle. Market economies are characterized by limitless choices for nearly all products. In a mixed economy government “steers” economic decisions with certain actions, like taxes on imports.
